question.text: What is the maximum temperature which parts made of Ultrason E (PESU) can withstand?
What is not a major advantage of Ultrason vs. other Engineering Plastics?

answers.answer: Only small changes of mechanical properties in a wide range of temperature

question.text: What is the typical melt temperature while processing Ultrason?
When would you recommend Ultrason S (PSU) instead of Ultrason E (PESU)?

answers.answer: When the part has to withstand temperature >200°C
When color and clarity is important
When part is exposed to non-polar solvents

question.text: What are the unique selling points of the newly developed Ultrason P?

answers.answer: Superior notched impact resistance and low smoke toxicity
